comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Three brightly sunlit Douglas AD-4 Skyraiders flying in echelon left formation. US Marine attack squadron VMA-212 'Devil Cats' / 'Lancers' tail code LD VMF-212 / VMA-212 'Devil Cats' info: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VMFA-212 reocities.com/CapeCanaveral/lab/5428/thehook.html All in overall Gloss 'Sea Blue'. Large national insignia and white side codes 16, 8 & 12 on engine cowlings. Large curved brown streaked area on fuselages from effect of engine exhaust fumes. During the Korean War, on 10 June 1952 the then VMF-212 was redesignated VMA-212 and following year changed over to Douglas AD-2 & AD-3 Skyraiders. Even after the cease fire on 27 July 1952, the 'Devil Cats' remained in South Korea until April 1955 when they flew their AD-4 "flying dump trucks" to MCAS Kaneohe Bay Hawaii, to join Marine Aircraft Group-13. In March 1958 VMA-212 traded their AD-6 Skyraiders for North American FJ-4B Fury's. Unfortunately serial number below horizontal tail of closest aircraft cannot be read because of inadequate copy quality so further research cannot as yet be made.
